intro: Dimorphotheca nudicaulis, commonly known as the narrowleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat, daisy-like head, surrounded by narrow, linear leaves. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Dimorphotheca nudicaulis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal and Mediterranean climates.
